results.name: The a(n)-th composition in standard order is the sequence of run-lengths of the n-th composition in standard order.
comment: A composition of n is a finite sequence of positive integers summing to n. The k-th composition in standard order (row k of A066099) is obtained by taking the set of positions of 1's in the reversed binary expansion of k, prepending 0, taking first differences, and reversing again. This gives a bijective correspondence between nonnegative integers and integer compositions.
link: Claude Lenormand, Deux transformations sur les mots, Preprint, 5 pages, Nov 17 2003.
example: The standard compositions and their run-lengths:

All of the following pertain to compositions in standard order (A066099):
- The partial sums from the right are A048793.
- Adjacent equal pairs are counted by A124762.
- Equal runs are counted by A124767.
- Strict compositions are ranked by A233564.
- The partial sums from the left are A272020.
- Constant compositions are ranked by A272919.
- Normal compositions are ranked by A333217.
- Adjacent unequal pairs are counted by A333382.
- First appearances of run-resistances are A333629.
